a.span: Breakfast & Lunch Available at Nine Sites and Along Four Delivery Routes
Grab-and-go | Monday - Friday between 12:00pm - 1:00pm at nine sites and along four bus delivery routes.
Governor Kate Brown Announces Statewide School Closure for Students in Oregon from Monday, March 16 through Tuesday, March 31. Breakfast & Lunch Available during the closure.

We are also aware some families will need devices to have enough access for their students to participate in distance learning. To improve access, we are asking parents who do not have a computer, laptop, or Chromebook for their student(s) to fill out the Chromebook Computer Request Form.
April 27, 2020 School Board Work & Executive Session

School Board Approves Moves Forward with Plans for 2020-21
Strategic investments from the Student Success Act were approved by the School Board that promise to improve student health and safety, and increase academic achievement.
District Graduation Rates Continue to Exceed State
Performance highlights both improvement success and opportunities for improvement.
The Budget Committee is seeking applications for one open position. The position will be open until filled.

A committee of Oregon City educators has spent the last year studying how later school start times can help improve the health of high school students. The Board has requested further analysis that will be discussed in a public work session on January 27th, 2020.

The plan for 2020-21 creates a window of time to complete safety and security updates throughout the school district. The calendar adjustment requires an early start to the 2020 school year. The first day of school will be August 24, 2020.
